title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 632/79 of 30 March 1979 amending Regulation (EEC) No 685/69 on detailed rules of application for intervention on the market in butter and cream
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 632/79  of 30 March 1979  amending Regulation (EEC) No 685/69 on detailed rules of application for intervention on the market in butter and cream
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Regulation (EEC) No 685/69 is amended as follows:    1. In Articles 6 (2) (c) and 24 (1) (c) the rate of interest "8 75 % per annum" is increased to "9 75 % per annum."
2. The following subparagraph is added to Article 23 (1):
"No storage contract referred to in paragraph 6 may be concluded for butter in respect of which application has been made for direct consumption aid for butter provided for by other Community provisions to be granted."
3. In Article 24 (1) (d), the amount "16 u.a." is replaced by "8 u.a.".
4. Article 27 is replaced by the following Article:
"Article 27
1. Storage aid for cream may be granted only in respect of pasteurized cream produced directly from milk and whose fat content is not less than 40 % and not more than 80 %.
2. In order to calculate the aid, the quantities of cream shall be converted into "butter equivalents" in relation to butter having a fat content of 82 %, by multiplying the fat content of the cream by 1 720.
3. Checking of the fat content referred to in paragraph 1 shall be carried out before the cream is frozen."

This Regulation shall apply from 1 April 1979.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
